definitions.definition: A point in a program at which operation may be interrupted during debugging so that the state of the program at that point can be investigated .
A location referred to when issuing watches , warnings , or advisories for specific areas .
The point where surface water waves are breaking in, e.g., oceans or lakes .
A viewport width at which a web page is programmed to adjust the properties (such as position, size, or visibility) of certain elements within the page.

main_definition: ( programming ) A point in a program at which operation may be interrupted during debugging so that the state of the program at that point can be investigated .
secondary_definitions: ( meteorology ) A location referred to when issuing watches , warnings , or advisories for specific areas .
( physics ) The point where surface water waves are breaking in, e.g., oceans or lakes .
( web development ) A viewport width at which a web page is programmed to adjust the properties (such as position, size, or visibility) of certain elements within the page.
